N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 22 §§ 130-2.2 - Order imposing sanctions and costs

State Regulations

The court may impose sanctions or award
costs or both only upon a written memorandum decision or statement on the
record setting forth the conduct on which the award or imposition is based and
the reasons why the court found the attorney's failure to appear at a scheduled
court appearance to be without good cause. The imposition of sanctions or an
award of costs or both shall be entered as a judgment of the court. In no event
shall the total amount of sanctions imposed and costs awarded exceed $2,500 for
any single failure to appear at a scheduled court appearance. Notes
